synopsis: Vote to pass a bill that requires builders of new single-family homes to offer buyers several water efficiency options, beginning January 1, 2011.
name: HB 1358 - Authorizing Home Buyers to Purchase Water Efficiency Devices Up Front - Colorado Key Vote
pg: Highlights: -Requires that builders of single-family detached residences offer buyers the following water efficiency options (Sec. 1): -The installation of water-efficient toilets, lavatory faucets, and showerheads; -The installation of dishwashers or clothes washers that are qualified by the United States Environmental Protection Agency's Energy Star program, if the machines are financed, installed, or sold through the home builder; -A landscape design that follows water-efficient landscaping practices, if the landscaping is financed, installed, or sold through the home builder and will be maintained by the home owner; and -The installation of a pressure-reducing valve that limits static service pressure in the residence. -Specifies that these requirements do not preclude a home builder from subjecting water-efficient fixture and appliance upgrades to the same terms and conditions as other upgrades, including, but not limited to, charges and deadlines (Sec. 1). -Specifies that these requirements do not apply to unoccupied homes, including, but not limited to, sales inventory and model homes (Sec. 1).
